text: Pleomele halapepe, the royal hala pepe, is a species of flowering plant that is endemic to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It inhabits dry, coastal mesic and mixed mesic forests at elevations of . It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== * World Conservation Monitoring Centre 1998. Pleomele halaapepe. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 23 August 2007. title: Pleomele halapepe
